snippet: A growing field of technology experts, financial players and entrepreneurs believe that mainland China’s unfavorable regulation of Bitcoin has put Hong Kong on the edge of something big.
abstract: Growing field of technology and finance experts are betting that an unfavorable regulatory environment in mainland China has poised Hong Kong to become a lucrative hub for Bitcoin; investors, undeterred by collapse in Bitcoin's value, are attempting to set up exchanges in the special administrative region, which has taken an exceptionally laissez-faire attitude even as many governments crack down on use of the digital currency.
lead_paragraph: A growing field of technology experts, financial players and entrepreneurs believe that mainland China’s unfavorable regulation of Bitcoin has put Hong Kong on the edge of something big.
